description: playing quake 3 on linux has always been a bit dodgy, packages dont work or you have to find something on a discord server, this works well out of the box with no struggle whatsoever thank you!
Tried it but it doesn't work.

1.- With flatseal, give permissions in ioquake3 to access the home folder.
2.- Next time you run ioquake, a ".q3a" folder is created in your home directory, but game still don't start.
3.- Copy the files from your legal "baseq3" to ".q3a/baseq3"
4.- Now ioquake3 flatpak should start correctly
summary: flatpak not working as expected? try this!

description: It's Quake 3 but in maintained. Who am I to not give it 5 stars?
